message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper proposes a novel model for overlapping entity mention recognition, which is a task commonly studied in natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision (CV) fields. The model is built on top of a new segmental hypergraph representation, which is a graph-based approach commonly used in NLP and CV. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The model also uses neural networks for feature learning, which is a common technique in machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) fields. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. The proposed model achieves state-of-the-art performance in benchmark datasets, which is a common evaluation method in CV and NLP fields. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) are also likely sub-categories.
